title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct configuration.

1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6 3d10
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct configuration.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for identifying Zn2+ with justification.

Zn2+ has the greater ionization energy. The electron being removed from Zn2+ experiences a larger effective nuclear charge than the electron being removed from Zn because Zn2+ has two fewer electrons shielding the nucleus.

OR

It takes more energy to remove a negatively charged electron from a positive ion than from a neutral atom.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correctly indicating the direction of ion flow.

As the cell operates, NO3− ions flow toward the Al half-cell and K+ ions flow toward the Zn half-cell.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for correctly indicating the direction of ion flow.

As the cell operates, NO3− ions flow toward the Al half-cell and K+ ions flow toward the Zn half-cell.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct E°.

E° = (−0.76 V) − (−1.66 V) = 0.90 V
descriptions:

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for indicating that ∆G° is negative.

1 point is earned for a correct justification.

ΔG° is negative since E° is positive and ∆G° = –nFE°

OR

ΔG° must be negative because the reaction is spontaneous under standard conditions.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for indicating that Ecell increases.

1 point is earned for the correct justification.

Lowering [Al3+] causes an increase in the cell voltage. The value of Q will fall below 1.0 and the log term in the Nernst equation will become negative. This causes the value of Ecell to become more positive.

OR

A decrease in a product concentration will increase the spontaneity of the reaction, increasing the value of Ecell.
